Articles.Content:
Does anyone know some good spacecraft names? I need some new awesome names

Something amazing like Curiosity, Spirit or Opportunity

I already made Sprite

Give it a go ^^
Ozymandias, Tiburon, Nautilus, Cassini, Ocelot, Octavius, Longrun...
Eldorado, Creepy pasta, Deus ex machina, Optimus, Totally not going to fail, fiat lux(Latin for let light be made).
If you can't think of any cool names why don't you try a random name generator, you can find a load of them by searching google

Invented, fictional and mythgological names are so much better than random names!

Dawn Treader

Naglfar

Argo

Bob. Always go with Bob. Simple and straight to the point.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Normandy

Enterprise

Nautilus
Here is a site to a bunch of name generaters I dont Know If There Any Good But Its A cool Site http://www.seventhsanctum.com/generate.php?Genname=shipnamer
On that website, I got Jesus' Carnage.... sounds good.
I like HMCSS Beagle
Ascent, Destiny, Hope, Nexus, Genesis, Explorer, Eagle, Nova, Flow, Globetrotter, Scalar, Persephone, Epsilon, Pi, Hornet, Galileo, Horizon
I like Thor, Zeus, Explorer, Intrepid for some of my rocket names. I have a space station named Duration since they're up there for, well, the duration. I named a satellite ship Relay.
Trautrus, New froniter, Agvona, nova Prime, White Light, Black Wrander, Titan 4, or The Anvger 2

There are literally thousands of Greek deities you can name your stuff out of, some who sound really awesome.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Greek_mythological_figures
On the theory that Kerbals are sentient tree seeds, I like to name my ships after trees/plants: Apple, Birch, Cottonwood, Dogwood, Evergreen, etc. Gives it a military code name feel...

I've been tending towards really boring names that are practically serial numbers. That said, anything euphonious from your favorite mythology (Greek, Norse, Sumerian, Egyptian, Lovecraftian, etc) should work well.

My current ones are boring. Lander, Lander 2, One-Way Trip, Flying Laser Platform (really), etc. They basically tell what they are. It's nice if you don't want to confuse which ship is which when you save a lot of them.

Ah, I like this thread.

For more ideas, some of my spacecraft names are Equinox, Korbit, Spacer, and Derp.

Revolver

Noble knight

Chastity

Voulge

Sedna

Eris (for the most troublesome craft)

Harmonia

Concordia

Dysnomia

Nix

Hydra

Gaia

Hekatonkheires

Lots of good names, and if you run out of names, start doing what I do and start naming rockets X1 or YA2
The haunted prostitute and the prostitute ogre is what I got from that website.

I'm a boring sod and use a standard for ease.

[Mission name][Crew(crew capacity)][No. LFE in ascent stage(numeral)]

So:

"Mun_Orb-bus 1(4) V"

Is a mission (mun orbit crew transfer), with 1 crew (with max capacity of 4) and 5 engines on the ascent stage.

Mission names are typically equally functional, prefix of the target (Kir_Orb, Mun_Orb, Mun_lander, Min_Orb, Min_lander) then it's purpose (Map, bus, or none if it's testing a launch system or no reason)

("Bus" is my nickname for a vehicle whose purpose is to carry more kerbals back to kerbin than what it launches with)

My thinking has been, if the ship is going to be one of many, give it a simple name that has a deep meaning (Odyssey, Aquarius, Discovery, etc.) and just add a roman numeral for the flight number (Odyssey V, Apollo XI, etc.).

For ships that we think of as one of a kind (not that it's a problem to get them back in KSP) Go with something a little more distinctive (Sword of Orion, The Sterling Marlin, Curiosity's Bolt, StarRanger, etc.)

It's a shame vessel names can't be longer without them being hard to display, as I'd like to see people name their craft the way boats are named, things such as "Drunk and Disorderly" "The Stars or Bust" and stuff like that.
I usually give my ships Military style names like MLV-3 (Munar Launch Vehicle) or LOV (Light Orbital Vehicle). Though recently I've been trying to create better names.
